intro: Hieracium cincinnatum subsp. virosiforme, commonly known as the toxic dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. It produces a milky sap that contains irritant compounds, which can cause skin reactions in some individuals. This subspecies is closely related to other hawkweeds and is known for its aggressive growth habits.
